text:
It looks like this default module:
```{% dnd_module
          path='@HubSpot/linked_image',
          img={
          "src" : "<https://f.HubSpotusercontent30.net/hubfs/xxxxxxx/dnd-template/art/homepage-hero-art-1.svg>",
          "alt" : "xxxx",
          "width" : 575,
          "height" : 400
          }
        %}
        {% end_dnd_module %}%}```
should set the height of the `<img>` element that it generates but it does not. Is that a bug? Should I make my own module or is there a better default option?
Is there a way to make a custom module have click editing in the preview pane when creating/editing a page similar to how modules have it when using Drag and Drop?

Is there anyway to a pull HubDB data row (_for example the name or title of that column_) into a field of choices? For example, my client has a list of Downloadables they use for the resource page in a HubDB table. I  want to build a module for them to be able select one resource from the database as a featured downloadable. That way they don't have to build each from scratch.

Is this possible to pull that data into a module field?
Unfortunately I don’t think it is. I typically just use a Text field for that and let them type in the value - unless it’s a rather static column in which case I’ll make a drop down myself for it.
